page.title: 13SAMLESBURY FARMING CHANGES
page.content: During wartime the work was done by men and horses. Then the tractors came in about 1943-44. Now machines can cut the silage and there are milking machines whereas people used to milk by hand. The machines are big and expensive and, when they get damaged, it costs a lot to get them repaired. Even the grass used to be cut by hand. Not as many farmers in Samlesbury grow potatoes now because in world war two farmers had to grow crops to feed the country. Hardly any farmers keep poultry these days. Farmers used to employ a lot more people than they do now. When it was hay time they had some Irish men working for them. The work the vet does has improved. He keeps the animals in good order and he has more antibiotics and penicillin now.
